comment._content:
"Three men fishing at the foot of a waterfall whilst another man rests behind them."

may be a more apt title.

comment.author: 14601421@N00
comment._content: Great capture. I wonder where the location is. Reminds me of the Pocconos in Pennsylvania... but is it actually Australia?

comment._content:
nice shot, 
Thanks for sharing all these

comment.author: 57529839@N00
comment._content: Hmm, looks to me like this is the same waterfall as this: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2697484668. The waterfall itself looks mostly the same but the real give away are the two large rocks just to the right of the three fishermen.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
51321042@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/14601421@N00] It is indeed Australia. It is Empress Falls in The Valley Of The Waters, Blue Mountains National Park, NSW. The track on the right still exists, I have walked it many many times. I doubt the gentlemen were fishing, but perhaps were trying to catch freshwater crayfish. You can still find them there.
